[vc_row type=”full_width_background” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#1b203e” bg_image=”6281″ bg_position=”center top” background_image_loading=”default” bg_repeat=”no-repeat” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”7%” bottom_padding=”10″ translate_y=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overflow=”visible” id=”services” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color=”#ffffff” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Black Tech Experience – Navigating the Tech Diversity Gap” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:44|text_align:left|color:%23000000|line_height:50px” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1735815762909{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Wednesday 15th October

6pm – 9.30pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-EZquaOzfgg” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754924310043{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Black Tech Experience event creates a powerful forum for Black tech professionals to discuss how to thrive in an industry where being “the only one” is all too common. This transformative event brings together innovators, trailblazers, and entrepreneurs from across the tech ecosystem to share proven strategies for navigating the diversity gap and creating meaningful impact.

Through insightful panel discussions, inspiring keynotes, and authentic conversations, attendees will discover how to leverage their unique perspectives as competitive advantages, build influence within their organisations, and collaborate on breakthrough tech innovations to solve big challenges.

Whether you’re climbing the corporate ladder, launching your own venture, or seeking to amplify your impact, this event will share the knowledge, connections, and inspiration needed to become a leader in the tech space.

Key themes:
1. Leverage your unique perspective as a Black tech innovator to tackle complex problems and ensure tech serves diverse users
2. Build confidence in advocating for disruptive ideas, securing stakeholder buy-in, and pushing the boundaries of what’s been done before
3. Discover how to position yourself for stretch opportunities and find paths to advance your career journey
4. Learn how to transform business ideas into market-ready solutions to solve key challenges
5. Understand how to stay competitive in an ever-changing tech landscape by assessing upcoming market disruptors[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20″][divider line_type=”No Adrian Cave

Head of Data Platform Engineering & Market Data Services for Asset & Wealth Management, J.P. Morgan[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Adrian 25 years of experience in leading and developing successful data & analytics solutions for major financial institutions. He currently leads Data Platform Engineering and Market Data Tech for JP Morgan Chase where he is responsible for modernizing the data & analytics architecture across Asset & Wealth Management.

Since joining JP Morgan Chase in 2014, Adrian has led several transformations including a Client Reporting Platform modernisation that resulted in a #1 Industry ranking. He also ran Internal Analytics Technology for a Commercial & Investment Banking business. Prior to joining JP Morgan, Adrian was at Bank of America where he spent 8 years within Global Markets Financing & Futures Technology leading various data and analytics related functions.

Adrian also sits on the JP Morgan London Technology Centre Leadership team and his area’s AIML Technology Leadership team.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ Mark Martin

Assistant Professor for Computer Science & Education Practice & Co-Founder, UKBlackTech[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Mark Martin MBE, known as @Urban_Teacher, is an Assistant Professor for Computer Science and Education Practice. With an expertise spanning AI and data science, he has been at the forefront of championing edtech and computer science education, delivering digital skills for the last two decades. His deep knowledge in these domains has made him an influential voice in the UK tech scene, serving as an advisor to the government, big tech companies, institutions, and charities. He fervently champions for home-grown talent, digital skills, and education equity. As a testament to his dedication and impact on the UK, he co-founded UKBlackTech in 2017, now one of the UK’s leading tech communities that champions innovation and digital transformation. Mark’s contributions to education, technology, and diversity in UK technology were recognised in 2019 when he was honoured with an MBE. Further, in May 2022, he was listed among the top 50 most influential people in UK IT by Computer Weekly.

text_direction=”default”]

Nnaemeka Obodoekwe

Chief Technology Officer, Lenkie[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Nnaemeka Obodoewke is the Co-Founder and CTO of Lenkie, the payables financing company powering the next generation of UK SMEs. Since 2020, Lenkie has deployed over £100 million to hundreds of businesses across multiple industries, helping them strengthen cash flow, scale faster, and build more resilient supplier relationships.

Nnaemeka leads the technology and product strategy, building the platform that underpins Lenkie’s underwriting, onboarding, and lending operations. His work focuses on creating scalable, data-driven tools that deliver a faster, smarter, and more impactful financing experience, unlocking growth opportunities for small businesses often overlooked by traditional finance.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Yomi Tejumola

Founder & CEO, Algomarketing[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Yomi is an award-winning entrepreneur and visionary technologist with a simple yet audacious mission: to restore joy and creativity to work by freeing people from mundane tasks. As Founder and CEO of Algomarketing, he leads the global talent solutions that industry leaders like Google, OpenAI, and Stripe rely on. Algomarketing embeds AI-proficient marketers directly into future-focused marketing teams, accelerating their adoption of AI and driving innovation.

Yomi holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science and Business Studies, and spent over a decade empowering large, complex marketing teams, including Google, with advanced automation and data science.

Whether advising global CMOs or building internal AI workflows, Yomi is relentless in his belief that the future of marketing will be built by those who scale human creativity through smart systems and smarter talent.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Ony Chima

Principal Project Manager, Transformation & Integration, bp[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Ony is a digital leader who is excited about how technology can transform organisations. He excels at crafting practical digital strategies and bringing them to life in different businesses. With a diverse background in consulting and industry roles, covering everything from vision setting to execution, and 

with experience in customer facing roles in energy, retail, and banking, he has deep expertise and brings strong customer focus in all that he does.

Ony cares about making a difference, he is currently a trustee for a charity that supports young people in the care system. He has also been involved in various mentoring programmes from prior universities and employers. 

His specialities are: Digital Strategy and Architecture, Portfolio Management, Cost Reduction & Operational Efficiency[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ Samantha Campbell-Springer

Senior Business Consultant & Business Change Specialist[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Samantha Campbell-Springer is a strategic leader in business change and stakeholder communication, with a strong focus on inclusive transformation and organisational development. As Senior Business 

Consultant, she drives initiatives that align internal mobility with sustainability and DEI objectives, delivering measurable impact across complex public sector environments.

Samantha is also the co-chair of her company’s Black Employee Network, where she advocates for equity and progression for underrepresented talent. Her dedication to social inclusion extends beyond the workplace, having served as a trustee for One Trust, a charity supporting individuals with learning disabilities and autism. [/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Emma Plomer

Senior Manager, Solution Engineering, Salesforce[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Emma Plomer, a Senior Manager in Solution Engineering, leads a team of technical sales consultants focused at Salesforce, a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) company. Having been at Salesforce for 13+ years, she has experienced first hand the explosion and complexities in the technology landscapes that Salesforce, the World’s #1 AI CRM company, is able to offer its business customers.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Bilal Hilton-Leigh

Investment Bank Data Integration Lead, UBS[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Bilal Hilton-Leigh is a senior product lead in global investment banking, driving adoption of an enterprise data mesh platform. With over two decades of experience across technology, compliance, and business transformation, Bilal has led major initiatives spanning multi-petabyte data platforms, data monetisation, post-merger integrations, and regulatory-driven innovation.

Beyond his core role, Bilal is recognised as a changemaker in tech and organisational culture. He has designed and championed employee networks, firm-wide inclusion strategies, leadership development programmes, and mentoring pathways that open doors for underrepresented groups. At the intersection of technology, strategy, and inclusion, Bilal brings a unique voice to the conversation on how data and AI can drive business transformation and impact.[/vc_column_text][divider text_direction=”default”]

Jenni Lewis

Director, Global Inclusion & Diversity, Block[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Bilal Hilton-Leigh is a senior product lead in global investment banking, driving adoption of an enterprise data mesh platform. With over two decades of experience across technology, compliance, and business transformation, Bilal has led major initiatives spanning multi-petabyte data platforms, data monetisation, post-merger integrations, and regulatory-driven innovation.

Beyond his core role, Bilal is recognised as a changemaker in tech and organisational culture. He has designed and championed employee networks, firm-wide inclusion strategies, leadership development programmes, and mentoring pathways that open doors for underrepresented groups. At the intersection of technology, strategy, and inclusion, Bilal brings a unique voice to the conversation on how data and AI can drive business transformation and impact.[/vc_column_text][divider Daniel Meikle

Head of Reliability & Obsolescence, Telent[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Daniel Meikle is Head of Reliability & Obsolescence at Telent, where he leads the engineering strategy that safeguards Transport for London’s communication and fire safety assets. With a background in systems engineering, he’s delivered projects ranging from CCTV upgrades to fire asset survey strategies, always focused on using technical solutions to improve resilience and extend asset life. 

He enjoys taking complex problems and breaking them into clear, practical outcomes. Beyond transport infrastructure, he’s applied the same engineering mindset to the catering industry — using innovation to diversify product ranges and explore new markets. Along the way, he’s been recognised at the Black Talent Awards and as a finalist at the Black Tech Achievement Awards. At his core, he’s passionate about engineering that works — for people, business, and communities.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” Demi Ariyo

Managing Director, Lendoe[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Demi Ariyo is the Founder and Managing Director of Lendoe, a pioneering finance platform providing access to funding for underestimated founders. With a background in investment and peer-to-peer lending, Demi has arranged millions in funding for entrepreneurs overlooked by traditional banks. Recognised by HSBC, Forbes, and The Great British Business Awards, his work has also been featured in the BBC Three documentary Spending Black, The Guardian, Business Insider, and the Financial Times.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%”
